questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance.
You need to implement role-based security for a set of fields in a table.
How should you arrange the security elements? To answer, drag the appropriate security elements to the correct locations. Each element may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//
questions.answer_description:
The following illustration shows the elements of role-based security and their relationships.

Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/sysadmin/role-based-security

questions.question_text:
A developer submits code for a quality assurance review. Several lines of code use the var data type.
You need to validate the segments for the correct X++ structure.
Which code statement will pass validation?

choices.A: var var1 = systemDataGet(); var1 = var1 ? today():ג€Not todayג€;

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A and C are both incorrect because of using '=' instead 0f '=='. All answers are wrong to me! I selected c because it doesn't let me submit my comment without selecting one!

Selected Answer: C
If I assume D is var var1 = true ? 10:"10" then C remains as the only statement that compiles.

Selected Answer: C
I suppose the first option was meant to look like this: 
var var1 = systemDateGet(); var1 = var1 ? today() : "Not today";

Then Visual Studio shows the following error: cannot implicitly convert from type 'str' to type 'date'.
So the correct answer is C.

questions.question_text:
You are training a new Dynamics 365 Finance developer.
You need to recommend where asynchronous integrations should be used instead of synchronous integrations.
For which scenario should you recommend asynchronous integration?

choices.B: When products are updated in Finance and Operations, a third-party application that contains the same product information needs to also be updated in near real-time.
choices.C: A retailer wants to ensure gift card balances are communicated back to the system from point of sale (POS) terminals in near real-time.
choices.A: A company uses workflow for purchasing approvals, which then sends just-in-time approval information to a third-party application for approvers to review.
choices.D: A retailer requires all new customer data captured at point of sale (POS) terminals through the day sent back to the system.

discussion.content:
Pessimestic and Optimistic right answer 
for ref related question was asked before
It should be Pessimistic and Optimistic

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

Which test attribute should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate test attributes to the correct descriptions. Each test attribute may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
